titlestmt.titleproper: Harry Gillett papers, Inclusive: 1953, undated, Bulk: 1953

note.p: © 2021 The Texas Collection. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: Finding Aid was generated by The Texas Collection staff, using the STAR Knowledge Center for Archives (SKCA) task that automatically creates EAD files from the Archive's SKCA catalog records.

did.head: Papers Summary
did.abstract: The Harry Gillett papers consist of a letter, postcards, and photos, mostly documenting the tornado that struck Waco, Texas, on May 11, 1953.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: Harry Allen Gillett was an educator in Waco, Texas. Born 1927 February 12 he earned bachelor’s and master’s degrees in elementary education (1948, 1952) from Baylor University. Harry Gillett passed away on 2008 October 12.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Harry Gillett papers document the 1953 May 11 tornado that devastated downtown and eastern Waco, Texas. Gillett’s letter begins on May 11, describing the storm that preceded the tornado, and then continues on May 12, detailing the tornado’s aftermath. Ten postcards illustrate various scenes of destruction around Waco. The papers also include six unidentified photographs, perhaps of Gillett’s family or friends.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Harry Gillett papers are arranged into 3 series: I. Letter, II. Postcards, and III. Unidentified photos.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: All requests for copying of materials must be submitted to The Texas Collection in writing. Please use the Request Form for Copying Materials sheet. Unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator (s) of this collection are in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

userestrict.head: Use/Re-use Restrictions
userestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Harry Gillett papers, Accession #3798, Box #, Folder #, The Texas Collection, Baylor University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Described by Amanda Norman. Released on 2014-04-25.
